thread.title: Learn about WWII combat medic's experiences
thread.title_full: Learn about WWII combat medic's experiences

title: Learn about WWII combat medic's experiences
text:
By Gayln PiperFirst Division Museum The memoirs of a World War II combat medic will be the subject of the next Date with History presentation of the First Division Museum at Cantigny Park. Editors Sanders Marble and Paul Herbert will discuss "A Doctor's War: The Memoir of Charles E. Tegtmeyer, Combat Surgeon in the 1st Infantry Division, 1940-1945" at 7:30 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, at Le Jardin restaurant inside the Cantigny Park Visitors Center, 1S151 Winfield Road, Wheaton. Admission and parking are free. related advertisement 
If you go What: Date with History discussion of "A Doctor's War," the memoir of a World War II combat surgeonWhen: 7:30 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21; doors open at 6:30 p.m.Where: Le Jardin restaurant in Visitors Center at Cantigny Park, 1S151 Winfield Road, WheatonCost: FreeInfo: firstdivisionmuseum.org The new book chronicles the life of Charles Tegtmeyer, a combat physician in the Army's 1st Infantry Division from 1940 to 1945. His memoir is a detailed and rare account of a doctor's philosophical and clinical approach to war. A recipient of the Distinguished Service Cross, Tegtmeyer consistently served in the places of greatest danger, including Normandy on D-Day, June 6, 1944. Copies of "A Doctor's War" may be purchased in the Cantigny Shop the evening of Oct. 21. A book-signing will follow the presentation. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. A cash bar will be available along with a limited food menu. Coffee is free. The event is part of the First Division Museum's Date with History, a monthly series featuring discussions with authors, panelists, historians and special guests. For information about upcoming programs, visit firstdivisionmuseum.org . Share this page
